body.p: “We could see from our dining-place Agamenticus “,” some forty miles distant in the north. Its two sides loomed thus: [image] so that about a third of the whole was lifted up “,” while a small elevation close to it on the east “,” which afterward was seen to be a part of it “,” was wholly lifted up.”
PE 14, pg. 178/ 9 July 1858-9 November 1858 / NNPM MA 1302:33 / T vol. # XXVII / PDF # XVII / JXI
